intro: Rhopalephora scaberrima var. fruticosa, commonly known as the shrub-like form of the silky hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring woody stems and palmate leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
